title: Infra Structure Storage Engineer
description:
Infra Structure Storage Engineer


Job Title: Infra Structure Storage Engineer

Client: Dish

Location: Denver, CO (Hybrid Model)

Pay Rate: $55-60/hr on W2 without benefits (Preferred to be on our W2)


Core Tasks

• Provide storage administration for Isilon NAS , Pure NAS, Pure SAN and AWS S3

• Configuring replication from source to destination arrays from Pure storage

• Operational Tasks like creating and adding Hosts and Host Groups, creating volumes and assigning them to hosts, creating protection groups for replication purpose

• Monitoring the replication status, health checks, performance of the storage arrays (EMC, Netapp, devices and switches, troubleshooting) and reporting on the SAN/NAS environment), pure array

• Performing LUN Provisioning, Creating the NFS shares, exporting to UNIX Servers, expanding/removing the LUNS and volumes

• Collecting the logs from the storage array level, coordinating with storage vendor, troubleshooting, performance analysis, and issue escalation with vendors

• Configuration/Removal active zones, zone members of Zoning, Administration, Aliases, Setup, Troubleshooting Switch port Issues

• Hands on experience on for remote replication SRDF/S, SRDF/A and troubleshooting recovering the failure SRDF/S and SRDF/A

• Configuring and managing snapshots & Data recovery from snaps

• Creating, Managing the Aggregates, Creating, increasing and decreasing the size of the volumes

• Scheduling and managing Snapshots, Configure, managing and restoring Snap-mirror relationship

• Configuring De-duplication for the volumes for effective space utilization

• Storage code upgrades on all storage arrays

Basic Qualifications

• Have a 4-year college degree in Computer Science / Information Technology, master’s degree is preferred or equivalent professional experience

• Industry certifications on storage array and fabric is an added advantage

• 10+ years of storage, SAN, NAS, Fabric operations support experience

• For Principal engineers and Architect with a 5+ years of storage design, implementation, managing high performing storage and leading a team of 5 or more

• Six or more years of technical experience working in a large enterprise setup

Other Qualifications

• Strong analytical and problem solving skills

• Good communication skills to interact with team members, customers, and managers

• Good personal computer and business solutions software skills

• Leadership skills to guide and mentor the work of less experienced team members

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team

description:
IMS Systems Programmer

  • 6 months Contract to Hire
  • 100% remote
  • Excellent benefits, 7% bonus on hire


Key Areas of Focus for this Role

  • Fulfill customer service requests for mainframe z/OS customers in a timely manner as they pertain to IMS and related OEM software products.
  • Provide primary support for reported problems related to IMS and related OEM software products.
  • Provide support on 24 x 7 x 365 basis across multiple time zones.
  • Follow procedures for installing OEM software products efficiently and according to best practices and Ensono standards (for productivity/scalability purposes).
  • Provide key support for customer migration services (new customer transitions) as they pertain to IMS and related OEM software products.
  • Assist the assigned project manager in the migration of newly acquired customers such that all technical hurdles are addressed in a timely manner and do not impede the expected progress of the transition nor the targeted migration date.
  • In joint cooperation with the Disaster Recovery Services, successfully execute tasks associated with any given customer’s disaster recovery plans.
  • Adhere to a schedule that efficiently manages resources and allows timely implementations.
  • Follow ITSM change control procedures


Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree required and/or equivalent work experience.
  • 10+ years of professional experience in IMS for administration and systems programming support. CA and IBM tools for IMS a plus
  • Extensive experience with the following:
  • Knowledge in best practices of software management, maintenance and documentation
  • Configure and manage IMS in a parallel sysplex environment
  • Develop innovation, strategies, processes and best practices in IMS systems programming
  • Troubleshooting and solving of IMS System issues
  • Evaluating change requests and determine impact to assigned clients
  • Troubleshooting and solving production database issues - VERY NICE To have

title: ServiceNow Asset Management Developer
description:
We're looking for a talented Mainframe WebSphere Programming Support Lead for a fully remote opportunity. In this role you will support Mainframe system programming and build, document, and configure WebSphere cells and variables. This is a fully remote opportunity; however, qualified applicants must reside in the DMV area.


Due to federal security contract requirements, applicant must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance.


Key Required Skills:

Solid ServiceNow Software Asset Management, CMBD and Discovery experience; ServiceNow Design and Architecture; Knowledge of infrastructure platforms

Position Description:

  • Serve as the Principal ServiceNow application developer responsible for implementing Software Asset Management solution design using best industry and ServiceNow practices
  • Facilitate requirements gathering and document requirements
  • Design and develop solutions within the ServiceNow environment to include new or modifications to applications, forms, flow, workflow, UI policies, UI actions, Business Rules, ACLs, UI Builder, and any other configurations required to support client processes
  • Translate requirements/stories and mock-ups into fully functional features by working closely with the team lead.
  • Develop JavaScript server/client code.
  • Create and use update sets and XMLs to move customer configuration and data between environments
  • Provide advanced support for ServiceNow by troubleshooting a variety of difficult software problems, implementing bug fixes, and performing root cause analysis.
  • Participate in discovery sessions and process definitions with team lead and other developers
  • Lead efforts and provide guidance in requirements gathering and developing/documenting process workflows
  • Develop ServiceNow solutions and push developments from DEV to TEST to PROD using Agile methodologies
  • Work with advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts.
  • Challenge with working on complex technical problems and providing innovative solutions.
  • Work with highly experienced and technical resources
  • All other duties as assigned or directed

Skills Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:

  • 7 years of direct development experience with the ServiceNow platform – ITAM including SAM, CMDB, Discovery, MID Servers, Workflow/Notifications, Workspaces, UI Policies, Business Rules, Client Scripts, Script Includes, Catalog Client Scripts, Catalog UI Policies, Email Scripts, ACL Roles / Groups.
  • 5 years of experience with importing and exporting data to ServiceNow using data loads, transform maps and transform scripts.
  • 5 years of experience developing ServiceNow SAM Implementations.
  • ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) - Software Asset Management (SAM)
  • ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Discovery
  • ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)
  • ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA)

Required Skills:

  • Solid ServiceNow ITOM Developer knowledge and experience (Software Asset Management, CMDB, MID Server and Discovery)
  • Skills with using JavaScript, REST and SOAP integrations
  • Experience with ServiceNow App Engine Studio with UI Builder
  • Experience designing and developing ServiceNow process flows and workflow

Desired Skills:

  • ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Software Asset Management
  • ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Discovery
  • ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)
  • ServiceNow Data Import experience
  • Agile development
  • System integration (SOAP, REST, Stored Procedures, Queues, etc.)
  • JavaScript, REST and SOAP integrations
  • Experience with process flow documentation creation.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree and 12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 years of prior relevant experience.
  • Must be able to obtain a Public Trust

title: C++ Developer with Server Management
description:
Title: C++ Developer with Server Management

Location: Santa Clara, CA/ Remote

Duration: Long Term

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Requirement analysis, design, code, unit test and fix defects in a range of scenarios such as spiking, regular release cycles, prototypes, customer escalations and PoCs.
  • Software development entails owning existing feature set, continually expand new product features and sustaining the product.
  • Resolve technical issues encountered by internal test and development teams.
  • Liase with vendors for firmware releases, firmware defects incident reporting and follow-up.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have 5-8 years of hands-on in-band and out-of-band server management experience

using IPMI 2.0 protocol & Redfish protocols. Experience must include at least 4 years

of hands-on c++ software development for automation of following server management. Examples

of server management tasks include the following:

1. manipulation of bios registry atributes, e.g., boot order, boot mode etc.

2. manipulation of bmc services e.g, ntp, active directory, etc..

3. power operations/sensors/LEDs

4. upgrade of server firmware BIOS/BMC/CPLD

5. firmware upgrade of PCIe cards, e.g., NIC, HBA, RAID

6. server configuration backups

7. virtual media to mount and install iso images

8. nfs to mount and install iso images

9. pxe booting of servers

10. boot loaders

  • C++ software product developer with minimum 5 years with c++ development experience. Must have history of multi-threading, locking, caching, distributed programming, and access control.
  • Must have experience in the use of STL and/or Boost for C++ development.
  • Must be at least 3 years prior experience translating redfish schemas in to software.
  • Must have at least 2 years of REST-based API development. Must be skilled at troubleshooting using tools like curl and postman.
  • Experience troubleshooting program core dump with gdb, generate core files, check memory leaks with valgrind, etc. Troubleshooting for performance bottlenecks.
  • Minimum of 5+ years on Linux.



Xoriant reasonably expects the pay rate for this position to be within the following range: $60.00/hour-$70.00/hour


Regards

Navnath Bhukan

navnath.bhukan@xoriant.com

title: Senior CyberArk Engineer
description:
Senior CyberArk Engineer

Description:

The Senior CyberArk Engineer will be responsible for developing and modifying custom CPM plugins. Additional responsibilities include the following:

  • Designing policy & deployment.
  • Installation and configuration of CP and CCP.
  • Custom CPM plugins development.
  • Developing scripts for onboarding accounts.
  • Developing scripts for vaulting activities.
  • Developing scripts for cleanup activities.
  • SSH key management POC and assisting with onboarding process.
  • DB POC including but not limited to Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB.
  • Architecting custom integration for Radio Access Network (RAN).
  • Assisting with upgrade activities.
  • Assisting the client team with operational activities & troubleshooting

Qualifications:

  • Experience onboarding accounts into CyberArk in a methodical and repeatable process
  • Experience interrogating, capturing, & analyzing how an application/system behaves in preparation for automatic password rotation via CyberArk For example: Anticipating edge/fringe cases that could cause the rotation to fail
  • Experience creating and customizing existing CPM plugins For example: customizing existing Unix plugins & creating new CPM plugins for webapps
  • Experience with creating and customizing plugins (not exhaustive): Windows, *Nix (RHEL, Solaris, etc.), Unix, Oracle DB, MongoDB, Cassandra, SQL Server, Snowflake, Misc. Apps (web & standalone)
  • Troubleshoot out of the box and custom CPM plugins
  • Experience with CyberArk or another Privileged Identity Management solution like Thycotic or BeyondTrust
  • Minimum 7+ years of experience in information security technology and regulatory controls within the telecom industry
  • Knowledge of current technological trends and developments in the area of security and its best practices as it relates to large scale environments
  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.

title: Oracle Apex Developer
description:
##This is a full-time W2 position. Please no agencies, third parties, or Corp-to-Corp.


Job Role: System Analyst

Job Location: 100% Remote (United States)

Job Duration: 6 Months Contract-to-Hire


Overview

Our Lead Oracle Apex developer is an integral team member who develops and maintains our Oracle Apex based applications. In role, you’ll be working as part of a small team to plan, coordinate, develop, implement the assignments/tasks related to the support of a large enterprise level applications for our customer.

Primary development duties the design, coding, and unit testing of Apex components, along with providing expertise and direction in the development and/or modification of additional capabilities.

Edit Overview

Responsibilities

  • Guidance, support and development of Oracle APEX features and capabilities
  • Develop and maintain APEX applications to track data, processes, and interfaces
  • Provide data requirements and other input to DBA for the design of database schemas
  • Develop stored procedures and functions, and maintaining the general health of data sources
  • Review Product Backlog Items for accuracy and practicality of implementation, design, and development applications, and provide support for correcting any errors identified through systems testing
  • Supports the application/database development throughout the Agile lifecycle
  • Articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences and, vice versa, translate functional needs to technical solutions.
  • Lead team meetings, agile meetings and coordinate all aspects of the project.


Edit Responsibilities

Qualifications

  • Minimum 5-8 years of experience is required.
  • Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in computer science or demonstrated equivalent experience
  • 4+ years of solid experience with Oracle APEX 17.x-21.x and Oracle Database 11g-21c: Experience with APEX security, authentication, and authorization schemes
  • 4+ years of solid experience with programming and software development around Agile or SDLC processes
  • 4+ years of experience PL/SQL – to include procedures, functions, packages, cursors, triggers, collections, transactional modeling, database normalization, indexing methods, constraints, performance tuning, security, auditing, and others
  • Experience with JavaScript, JSON, Web Services, XML, HTML, & UI/UX
  • 3+ years of experience leading technical teams
  • Ability to pass a US Public Trust background investigation for access to the client site and computing systems.

Additional nice to have:

  • Experience with Microsoft Power BI a plus
  • Experience with JIRA and writing technical requirements preferred.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Remote In: CA, CO, CT, Washington DC, FL, GA, IL, IA, IN, KS, LA, MA, MD, NC, NJ, NV, NY, OR, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA

As a Senior Software Engineer on the Contracting team, you will play a significant role in designing and delivering on the frontend architecture for AgentSync's newest product. You will collaborate with other members of the team to deliver on our most challenging projects, while also partnering closely with product and business owners. The ideal candidate will always keep an eye out for innovative ways to solve problems. You will bring your deep expertise in front end development to the team to help shape a scalable product.

What you'll do:
  • Build web applications in React, typescript as focus area
  • Write and maintain unit, integration and regression tests. Test using technologies like React Testing Library, Cypress, jest, and cucumber
  • Write and maintain Java code
  • Write and maintain unit and integration tests as needed
  • Maintain application infrastructure as code and running on AWS, GCP etc (example: CloudFormation, AWS cdk)
  • Tackle green field problems and operate against ambiguous problem statements
  • Perform thoughtful code reviews with scalability and clean code principles in mind
  • Communicate clearly and accurately with internal teams re: progress on features, blockers to delivery, timelines
  • Participate in helping to build and maintain a culture of engineering best practices
  • Help mentor other engineers
  • Advocate for the advancement of DEI initiatives within the organization

Your experience:
  • 4+ years experience building enterprise level front end software using a modern JS technology stack (React, Redux preferred - Vue etc)
  • Experience using testing frameworks and comfortable writing Cypress tests.
  • Experience developing APIs, especially RESTful APIs using Java, .NET or other technologies
  • The desire to work on a collaborative, learning oriented team using agile practices
  • Experience productively collaborating cross-team with all areas of engineering
  • Structured and well-organized work cadence with comfort tackling complexity and ambiguity
  • A strong track record of problem solving and a "roll up your sleeves" mentality

Research shows that people from historically excluded and underrepresented backgrounds read experience requirements in job descriptions and consider themselves unqualified if they don't meet every single requirement listed. This section is meant to focus on the experience we're looking for and minimum requirements for the role. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement listed here. We know that every person has unique strengths, and we focus on hiring for those strengths and potential, rather than looking for someone who meets every bullet listed.

About us:

AgentSync is a powerful, easy-to-use Compliance as a Service solution, directly integrating regulatory database sources of truth (i.e. NIPR, FINRA) with core business systems (i.e. Salesforce) so we can automate the critical business processes associated with these compliance requirements.

We're a new-school solution tackling an age-old, ubiquitous problem with smart technology and automation in a market full of inefficient, high-cost solution options - spreadsheets, manual processes, legacy software, more headcount, outsourcing, etc.

Salary:

In accordance with Colorado law, the following represents AgentSync's reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation for this role, if hired in Colorado.

Denver/Boulder Metro

$160,000 - $185,000

Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in AgentSync's equity program.

100% Company Paid Healthcare Insurance (for you and dependents)
  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Parental leave and return to work childcare stipend

Financial Benefits
  • 401(k) retirement savings plan

Other Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 12 paid holidays per year

description:
Its 6 months to Hire role, need Green Card or Citizen

Salary at conversion $135-$165K

Looking for true Sr. SRE

Notes

The ideal candidate really needs to drive out and build the capabilities, they need to think big based on the plans for this group.
  • Lead the teams, drive how we develop with work within the businesses
  • Very strong communication
  • Willing to dig in and not afraid of getting into the weeds
  • Performance management, tuning
  • They will be supporting applications and moving things to the cloud this will be a mix of legacy and net new applications
This Person Needs To Demonstrate The Following
  • Understands the SRE Pillars of SRE
    • Key areas of this would be in the following order
      • Incident Management
      • Measurement
      • Observation
      • Deployment
        • Secondarily
          • Performance Management
          • SLA's
          • Culture
  • The person needs the ability to articulate the capabilities of what needs to be brought to the table and how to execute and implement the solutions within the pillars. In addition, they need to understand how to bring the capabilities together to drive automation and execute the SRE Roadmap
  • This person will be an individual contributor to start and this team will likely grow to 6-8 individuals
  • They also use Data Dog and Cloudwatch for monitoring
Technical Skills Needed

Really need strong terraform experience (the operate infrastructure as code

Gitlab/Github (Automate Deployment)

Elastic Monitoring for log aggregation

Ideally, they would have experience with the AWS suite of services (ex. EC2, EKS Clusters, ECS Services)

Need an understanding of CICD

Nice to have experience with Java if at all possible would be ideal (not necessarily)

This person does not need coding but they should have scripting experience

Purpose

This position covers detailed knowledge in operating systems, operational tools, Networks, data base management software and other similar systems support software. Focuses primarily on information and document requirements for data, workflow, logical process, hardware and operating system environment, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and outputs. Embedded in development teams.

Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) are responsible for keeping all customer-facing services and other UNFI production systems running smoothly. SREs are a blend of pragmatic operators and software craftspeople that apply sound DevOps engineering principles, operational discipline, and mature automation to our operating environments and the UNFI applications' code base.

SREs specialize in systems (operating systems, storage subsystems, networking), while implementing best practices for availability, reliability, and scalability, with varied interests in algorithms and distributed systems. The team's experience feeds back into other Engineering groups within the company, as well as to drive operational maturity.

Job Responsibilities
  • Breadth and depth knowledge of constructing, refining, and maintaining cloud services to meet business requirement.
  • Execute CI/CD deployment pipelines to deliver various application code deployments to our production environment
  • Build and monitor our production systems utilizing various monitoring and logging tools such as Elastic, Prometheus/Grafana or other similar capability
  • Debug production issues across services and technology stack to remediation following the UNFI incident management process.
  • Define and support the adherence to SLA's/SLO's as defined by applications and measure for compliance.
  • Plan for future growth by working with application teams to ensure that scalability needs are considered both in the cloud and on-prem
  • Build a culture of shift left quality working with Product teams and DevOps to implement automation, monitoring and self-healing approaches.
  • Collaborate with Quality Engineering on application performance management supporting monitoring, APM tests, Capacity management and auto-scaling solutions.
  • Focus on automating operational processes using tools like Ansible to remove manual effort
  • Execute Terraform scripts as needed to rebuild infrastructure in situations as needed.
  • With only general direction and guidance conduct special assignments of a highly complex and technical nature and develop alternative strategies which have an important effect on planning or meeting objectives.
  • Document findings of study and prepare recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures, or organizational changes. Report findings to principal engineer, staff, and management as required.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Education/Certification

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science a related discipline preferred
Experience
  • 4-6 years relevant work experience in SRE/DevOps preferred
  • Knowledge of modern software development process such as Agile Scrum, Kanban or Scrumban
Knowledge
  • Must have strong computer skills within stated area of engineering expertise and must be proficient in use of Microsoft Office applications
Skills/Abilities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong customer focus and demonstrated ability to work in geographically dispersed teams
  • Ability to manage competing priorities while working on concurrent projects and/or simultaneous support tasks across multiple business or technical units
  • Logical thought process and ability to learn new systems, concepts, and procedures
  • Must be able to mentor junior engineers in new systems, concepts, and technical procedures
  • Provide breadth and depth technical advice and serve as a technical training resource to management and staff.
  • Exercise judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selection methods, techniques, and evaluation criterion for obtaining results.
  • Work with software vendors to resolve issues and implement recommended system and application changes.
  • Apply knowledge base technical expertise in decision making and in the resolution of problems which are highly complex and technical in nature.
  • Must exemplify excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must have experience in CI/CD pipelines to production systems.
  • Must be able to make accurate decisions related to task delegation and provide leadership in filling project and/or support team responsibilities
  • Must be available to work off hours or shifts as required for 24/7/365 support.
Please share your resume to career@ekodusinc.com

title: Research Scientist, Molecular Epidemiology (REMOTE)

Salary : $68-$73/hour


A leading biopharmaceutical company are looking for a Molecular Epidemiology Scientist to join their team! The Research Scientist, under the supervision of Molecular Epidemiology Head within the Biomarker Sciences, will be responsible for conduct and analysis of epidemiology studies using observational real-world databases. The position is expected to work across therapeutic areas that include oncology, virology, and immunology.


Summary


The Biomarker Sciences department is dedicated to conduct biomarker and translational research to further understanding of specific aspects of biology, inform research, development and pipeline decisions, and advance the effectiveness of available therapies in appropriate patient populations. The Molecular Epidemiology team supports biomarker activities by integrating real-world data and epidemiologic evidence within the biomarker discovery and development strategy.


Responsibilities


  • To lead analysis of epidemiologic studies using large administrative and electronic health records (EHR) data including clinico-genomic and specialized EMR data to support biomarker and drug development activities.
  • To work with lead epidemiologist to develop protocol and analysis plan for RWD studies
  • To work with functional partners to access RWD data repositories and conduct analysis in compliance with company policies
  • To work collaboratively on multi-functional projects and interact with biomarker scientists and scientists from other functions including clinical pharmacology, biology, bioinformatics, clinical research, and clinical data science on a regular basis.
  • To effectively communicate study findings through internal presentations, assist in drafting conference abstracts and manuscripts for publication in peer reviewed journals.


Qualifications


  • Candidates should have a doctoral degree in epidemiology, statistics, data science, health or other relevant fields with at least 2 years or master's degree with at least 5 years of relevant post-degree experience, preferably in pharma/biotech or related research organizations/academia
  • Should have experience in developing analysis plan and conducting analysis for observational studies using real-world EMR or claims data or large observational data.
  • Experience with multi-omics database and/or experience in molecular epidemiology studies is a plus
  • Should have a good grasp of statistical methodology required for observational studies (descriptive, bivariate and multivariate statistics).
  • Should have proficiency with statistical software (SAS, R, etc.) and programming.
  • Experience in applying novel analytical or computational (machine learning) technique and data science expertise to integrate and mine large complex data is a plus.

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Chameleon Technologies is working for our direct client, a network-AI company, to help them fill their contract Test Automation Engineer position opening. This is a 12 month long contract and candidates must be willing to work EST hours. Targeted hourly rate is $38-$42/hour.


**PLEASE NOTE our client cannot facilitate sponsorship or do C2C at this time.**


Chameleon Technologies is searching for a Test Automation Engineer for a contract role. This position can work remote, however you will need to work in U.S. eastern time zone hours. Hourly pay range for this role is $38-$42.


Job Description

The software developer will work as part of a DevOps team to test, maintain and operate the systems involved in the project. As part of learning the testing function, you will work to automate the testing function.

The system automates the process of capturing the company’s mobility services design, and network design to aid in the deployment of the network functions that are part of each service definition. The system has several layers as described below – testing and test automation encompasses all the layers.

  1. The day-to-day duties would include: Prepare test data with a view to test automation
  2. Write and execute test cases; convert select test cases for test automation
  3. Conduct test case reviews and plan test automation strategy for platform releases
  4. Requirements and design analysis
  5. Create / update tickets in Jira
  6. Participate in deployment decisions
  7. Support user community of application
  8. Participate in design discussions/scrum meetings.
  9. Test all layers of the software system (front-end Web UIs, APIs, back-end, DB, etc.)


  1. Key skills needed (in priority order): 5+ Years’ experience in the above activities, with at least 3+ years on test automation – specifically automation of testing front-end frameworks (React, JavaScript/jQuery) and backend (Python, shell, relation databases, etc.)
  2. A thorough understanding of various data formats (JSON, YAML, …) is critical
  3. A thorough understanding of feature, integration, system, capacity/load, regression and chaos testing is essential
  4. Database and Linux/UNIX experience is essential
  5. Thorough understanding of all testing principles is essential
  6. Experience with test automation is highly desirable
  7. A basic understanding of networking and network routing concepts is essential. A very good understanding of networking concepts (IP addressing, routing, etc.) is highly desirable


*** Candidate must submit a second document along with their resume. This document must contain one or two completed sample scenarios with data sets for a small feature of the candidate’s choice (a brief description of the feature before writing the test case is essential) that were automated.


Preferred Work Location:

Middletown NJ

title: Software Developer in Test
description:
About JustFund


JustFund is a nonprofit grantmaking B2B SaaS platform providing philanthropy with a new kind of giving experience: one that is values-aligned, rooted in equity, and built on trust. JustFund is the only nonprofit grantmaking solution designed by funders and organizers of color. We leverage a custom-built technology to ensure values-aligned funders can easily center equity in their grantmaking.


We fund transparently and move critical resources to chronically underfunded organizations. We are looking for a candidate who is excited about working with funders to move more money to movements. You will need to be values-aligned, highly organized, bring exceptional user management skills, and be committed to centering equity and service in every engagement


To learn more about JustFund, please visit us at:


Scope of Services


JustFund is seeking a short-term Software Developer in Test contractor who will shape the test strategy of JustFund’s B2B SaaS platform. Working directly with the Head of Product and Engineering, you will define and execute a holistic test strategy that includes writing, manually testing and automating detailed test cases for sprint features to ensure timely delivery of the features. You will also provide automated test coverage for the existing product functionality.


Shape and Develop Holistic Test Strategy


  • Collaborate with Head of Product and Engineering to create, deploy and maintain JustFund’s test suite
  • Add automated test coverage to existing product functionality
  • Drive and execute test strategy for new feature work delivered by two scrum teams on an ongoing basis.


Maintain High Quality of Product and Track Quality KPIs


  • Write detailed test cases for sprint deliverables that match the acceptance criteria
  • Manually QA the test cases for 2 week sprint deliverables
  • Automate the critical test cases for 2 week sprint deliverables
  • Track UAT pass rates for sprint deliverables
  • Track regression rates for sprint deliverables
  • Prepare recommendations to further track and improve product quality


Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience.
  • 8-10 years of experience as a Software Developer in Test
  • Minimum 2 years of experience working in an agile environment with multiple scrum teams.
  • Minimum 1 year of experience working in a fast growing startup environment
  • Minimum 1 year of experience working in a B2B SaaS product
  • Experience in Jest, Enzyme, Circle CI or other similar tools
  • Previous exposure to Aha, Jira, MySQL, and experience with a variety of analytical tools, including Google Analytics.
  • Experience in, or a passion for, philanthropy, social justice organizing, advocacy, or movement building, a plus.
  • Excellent written, oral communication, and cross functional coordination skills.


How to Apply


JustFund is seeking a Software Developer in Test for a short-term three month contract position, with potential for extension.


All proposals should apply by submitting their resume and cover letter, which should include your hourly rate.


Black people, people of color, indigenous people, women, femmes, gender nonconforming people, persons with disabilities, justice involved or formerly incarcerated people, and LGBTQIA+ people are particularly encouraged to apply.


JustFund is committed to having a values-driven, transparent, healthy, and collaborative culture. If the JustFund team can make the application process more accessible through accommodation in the application process, please let us know by emailing .

-Ability to debug, troubleshoot and problems solve within Python.

-Open to working within Information Security

-Information Security background

Day to Day:

A large financial enterprise in Phoenix, AZ is looking for a Remote Python Operational Coder to join their Information Security Organization. This team is responsible for Network Access Control, Virtual Private Networks, and Data Encryption. This team oversees the operational coding aspect of allowing administrative tasks to move quickly. This team has Linux appliances and Windows Machines, in which their Admin Tools fall within windows. You will not be coding and programming applications from scratch but more so debugging, problem solving and working on the operational aspect of Python. As other teams change or add APIs, update their servers, it is important that you are able to debug, update and run reports that match to ensure alerts and monitoring of this teams applications are correct and run on time. Being that this role falls within the Information Security organization, it is not a requirement that you come from that background but highly desired that you have an interest (i.e. working on virtual networks or VMware at home, playing around with computers, etc). This manager loves people who have a great love for technology and want to learn more every day!

Summary

The Senior Software Engineer will help build the Next Gen Applications Suite. The incumbent will use industry best practices and work collaboratively with cross-functional team of product managers, UX designers, architects, principal engineers, software engineers, test automation team and DevOPS engineers



ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Performs as a key contributor to an engineering team that builds and supports exceptional products that provide innovative solutions to challenging business use cases, existing system and operational problems

Participates in architectural design, system analysis, and programming activities on application software; this may often require independent research and study

Develops high-quality and production-ready software by using best-practice data structures, algorithms, design patterns, and frameworks that are maintainable, scalable, responsive, and secure

title: Sr. Developer, SAP Hana
description:
POSITION OBJECTIVE:

This position is primarily responsible for converting project specifications into code for various programs or applications based upon business demands or client requests. Designs and constructs large enterprise data warehouse solutions to support Retail business needs. Integrates new systems with existing data warehouse structure and refines system performance and functionality.


FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develops, updates, and maintains various programs or software packages to handle specific jobs or functions based upon business/client needs.

Develops, analyzes, reviews, and updates programs, using workflow chart and diagram, and applying knowledge of computer capabilities, subject matter, and symbolic logic.

Performs or directs revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.

Documents design specifications, installation instructions, and other system-related information.

Designs strategies and solutions for enterprise data warehouses on the SAP BW, SAP HANA, and SAP Business Objects platforms, and set standards for operations, programming, and security. Collaborates with engineers, system architects, software architects, design analysts, and others to understand business or industry requirements and select appropriate design solutions or ensure the compatibility of system components.

Tracks and resolves functional defects of varying sizes and severity.

Performs systems analysis and programming tasks to maintain and control the use of computer systems software as a systems programmer.

Compiles and writes documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.

Prepares detailed project plans and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language.

Consults with and assists end users or system analysts to define and resolve problems in running programs.

Creates and enforces data warehouse development standards, verifying the stability, interoperability, portability, security, or scalability of system architecture.

Demonstrates data warehouse technical functionality, such as performance, security and reliability.

Designs data warehouse applications, such as interfaces, data transfer mechanisms, global temporary tables, data partitions, and function-based indexes to enable efficient access of the generic database structure.

Designs data warehouse solutions to support business applications, ensuring system scalability, security, performance and reliability.

Develops data models for applications, metadata tables, views or related database structures.

Develops load-balancing processes to eliminate down time for backup processes.

Develops or maintain archived procedures, procedural codes, or queries for applications.

Communicates with staff or clients to understand specific system requirements including system data, hardware, or software components.

Provides technical guidance or support for the development and implementation of various systems including project costs, design concepts, or design changes.

Monitors system operation to detect potential problems and provides 24/7 on-call technical support as needed on a rotational basis.


COMPENTCIES

•Culture

Living the Company’s FAS Values and Guiding Principles by demonstrating Customer Focus, Instilling Trust, Driving Engagement and Delivering Results with High Performance.

•Decision Quality

Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.

•Action Oriented

Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.

•Interpersonal Savvy

Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people.

•Situational Adaptability

Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

7+ years of SAP data modeling experience including Data sources, Info providers, Info Packages, Transformations and Update Rules, BEx queries, workbooks, key figures, and variables

Proven track record in SAP IS-Retail and associated modules (including MM, SD, FI, PP, WM, POSDM), t-codes, data structures, and process flows

Experience utilizing SAP HANA and associated design techniques and development tools, including HANA Studio, Virtual Providers, and SLT. Must have at least 1 full life cycle SAP BW implementation on the HANA platform

Proven SAP BI ABAP development experience, including user exits, function modules, and start/end/expert routines

Experience on both SAP BW 7.3 and 7.4 platforms, including integration with SAP Business Objects. Experience in SAP BW/4 will be added advantage.

Thorough understanding of technology trends and developments in application architectures

Thorough knowledge of infrastructure architectures and data architectures as it pertains to their field of expertise

Thorough knowledge of application architecture deliverables (Designs, Flow Charts, code, documentation, etc.)

Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to create and maintain positive and professional business relationship with both internal associates and external customers

Must be able to work effectively in a team environment and effectively meet project deliverables on time

title: Associate Cloud Engineer
description:
Job Description

Associate Cloud Engineer
  • You will work on small to large complex requests with respect to deployed cloud infrastructure technologies within Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS.

  • Candidate will interact with Cloud team, engineering, and operations with respect to production and development, providing input around process improvements between teams, between customer relationships and business tool owners.
  • The candidate will feel comfortable handling complex operational, day 2 operational issues, upon escalation.
  • The candidate will feel comfortable with coaching other members of the cloud teams.
  • This candidate will work independently and collaboratively with varying skillsets across the organization, with latitude for independent judgment and consulting with peers on all projects.
  • Deliver Network Infrastructure and Security standards and practices across the organization. Utilizing Enterprise Terraform and ancillary technologies, such as Bitbucket to drive standards
  • Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.
  • Evaluate various lines of business requirements, compare that with available cloud technologies, and through collaboration, produce a technical solution that is cloud ready.
  • Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operation time and form of desired results.

  • Proactively investigate known and unknown error conditions; following prescribed error correction processes as well as documenting resolutions that were not previously identified.
  • Analyze problems/trends with client systems and applications and takes steps to avoid recurrence.
  • Recognize abnormal processing conditions and raise appropriate issues as needed.
  • Re-engineering processes to deliver greater effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Identifies/documents how applications and systems interact to support business processes.
  • Assesses, applies, and projects the impact of system changes on users and internal and external clients or stakeholders.
  • Uses knowledge of systems and industry requirements to develop or modify complex information systems.
  • Will mentor, guide, advise and/or check the work of less experienced business systems analysts.
  • Considers business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.
  • Other related duties assigned as needed.
  • This position typically requires five or more years of IT architecture and cloud operational experience.

  • Azure
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
  • A Bachelor's degree in computer science or information systems Required, Master in Computer Science or Security desired.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:
  • Advanced Soft skills around working with people.
  • Ability to listen and exhibit empathy all in an effort to drive customer satisfaction.
  • year of Hashicorp Terraform Enterprise development with the following key skills: Terraform CRUD operations
  • Terraform modules -- how to consume and contribute to them Terraform remote states
  • Terraform state management
  • Proficient in translating abstract solutions into fully developed Terraform Enterprise code utilizing a combination of disciplines/concepts like modules and state.

  • 1 or more years of supporting Azure Cloud and AWS Cloud (Expert working Knowledge in Both Cloud are a requirement).
  • Google Cloud is desirable.

  • 1 or more years of Network Support and troubleshooting
  • Proficient knowledge of IP networks, subnets, routing.
  • 1 or more years of coding solutions and scripting processes for automation.
  • Microsoft Active Directory, LDAP technologies, etc.
  • 1 or more years of experience deploying and troubleshooting key cloud network technologies: Load balancer, Application load balancers, firewall.
  • 1 or more years of experience of integration with cloud deployed solutions, back to on premise data centers, cross cloud integrations, etc.
  • Administration of Microsoft Windows Operating systems and Linux Red Hat Operating systems.
  • Excellent customer service skills that build high levels of customer satisfaction for internal and external clients.
  • Excellent collaborative skills and attitude.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization, e.g., executive, management, individual contributors

Wolters Kluwer is looking for a hands-on Lead Enterprise Software Engineer in our Infrastructure Portfolio Management (IPM) Team supporting the Tax and Accounting (TAA) Division to design, build, and integrate or next generation of enterprise cloud capabilities. Working within our Service Delivery team and collaborating closely with our Engineering team, Security, Compliance, and other key stakeholders, the lead engineer will be responsible for driving key projects and initiatives in support of TAA's critical applications in the Professional Market.

Our Lead Enterprise Software Engineer will work closely with other Engineers developing cutting edge, cloud native, micro-services architecture-based enterprise applications to enable public cloud consumption for the TAA Division in a standardized manner. In addition to providing thought leadership to the engineering group, and participating in Communities of Practice, the lead engineer will play a key role in developing the roadmap for the organization.

The engineers are relied on for automating activities that are otherwise manual and bringing efficiencies to existing processes. In addition, automation engineers champion the development of reusable solutions/templates the latest capabilities that cloud has to offer.

This job is for you if:

· You're a deeply motivated Engineer at heart who wants to transform solutions to be resilient, self- healing, and scalable.

title: Sr Application Security Engineer
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

The role is with a FT500 Financial Institution. You will report directly to the Director of Security Architecture and Product Security.


Current Information Security team of 150 people across the US.


This is a fulltime position (no C2C). The role is fully remote.


The company offers a competitive base salary + stock program + 401k matching + PTO (3 weeks + 5 sick days) + dental/vision/life/health.



RESPONSBILITIES:

The team has broken the responsibilities down in 4 pillars:


1) Making sure scanning tools function successfully

Bi-weekly scans are running in the environment. You are responsible for monitoring the desk program/scans to ensure it runs properly and reviewing the results.


Performing a cursory scan of solution. You are responsible for ‘low level troubleshooting- tasks’ such as telling the tool where to point to and ensure login credentials are working properly i.e. ensure credentials not expired, password correct. Having the persistence to trouble shoot and fix.



2) Reviewing vulnerabilities with business and partner with Dev teams to produce solutions

The offshore team typically performs level 1 triaging. This role sits more on level 2 and 3 i.e. reviewing the pattern, evaluating whether true or not, ensure it passes the general sniff test and oversee the remediation (work with Dev). Expert in reviewing these results.


Part of reviewing the pattern is being hands-on with the code. This includes configuring app in scanner, get in code base, inspect code base, trace code base, trouble shoot whether true positive or not and support/track remediation.



3) Penetration testing readiness

The vulnerabilities found from the pen test get fixed by Development teams. This person will be responsible for validating all pieces to ensure that the pen test is ready for a re-test (i.e. do all credentials work, do some limited re-testing to ensure it’s fully ready for retest).



4) Automating processes

Responsible for automating some change processes and weekly metrics. This is where limited Development will be included (preferably in .NET and C#).


MUST HAVE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an application development role
  • Minimum of 2 years in a Cybersecurity role (flexible on order)
  • Experience with C# or .NET coding
  • Proactive working approach and excellent stakeholder management to troubleshoot and remediate



LEARN MORE?

Please contact noortje.jacobs@parallelconsulting.com if you want to learn more.

Job Description


*Remote Opportunity*


ENSCO Avionics is looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our team who has experience in working with full DO-178 B/C software life cycle. You will be authoring and collaborating on the development of certification plans (PSAC, SDP, etc) and standards (Software Requirements, Design, Modeling and Code) for safety-critical embedded software for an eVTOL aircraft. Your responsibilities will include collaborating with the software team to define the processes, guidance and strategies used in development and verification.


At ENSCO Avionics, we take our tagline “Ideas to Reality” very seriously. Joining ENSCO is an opportunity to advance humankind through technological and scientific discovery. Our dedicated workforce is diverse—in background, experience, skills, and interests. ENSCO Avionics employees are encouraged to be courageous and innovative in their ideas and work collaboratively to help develop cutting-edge technology and inventions that make future dreams a reality. ENSCO Avionics offers a supportive and unique culture, positive work environment, and flexible work schedules that empower its employees to achieve their maximum potential.

  • Min 3 yrs relevant experience
  • Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent degree/experience
  • Hands-on experience writing software certification plans (PSAC, SDP, SCMP, etc) following guidance of DO-178B/C for safety-critical software
  • Hands-on experience writing software standards or experience following software standards
  • Hands-on experience with writing Software Requirements
  • Hands-on experience with DOORS or a similar requirement management tool
  • Excellent communication skills (verbally and written)

For more than 35 years, ENSCO Avionics has developed sophisticated airborne systems for the aerospace industry to meet DO-178C, DO-254, DO-278A, and military standards for manned and unmanned systems. ENSCO Avionics focus is on safety- and mission-critical software and programmable hardware engineering solutions, custom display development, tailored synthetic vision applications, integration test solutions, and the IData® Tool Suite. title: Sr. Data Engineer / Data Wrangler / Data Pipeline Builder
position_name: Sr. Data Engineer / Data Wrangler / Data Pipeline Builder
function_name: Information Technology, Product Management, and Consulting
company_sector: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Hi,

Please go through the complete job description thoroughly. If you are interested, please go ahead and send me your most recent updated resume along with your Contact#'s, hourly rate / salary expectation, visa status and your current location.

Any questions, please feel free to call me asap at 717-856-8189 or email me at suresh@lingatech.com

Urgent Job Opening – Sr. Data Engineer / Data Wrangler / Data Pipeline Builder -- BIG DATA, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Data Pipelines, Data Wrangler, Data Architectures, Data Sets, Data Transformation, Data Structures, Metadata, Data Dependency Relational Databases, NoSQL databases, Oracle, MS SQL Server, Postgres, Cassandra, Data Pipeline, Data Workflow Management, Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Data Integration Services solutions, Informatica, MuleSoft, Talend, TIBCO, CLOUD-based data services, AWS (EC2, Glue, EMR, RDS, Redshift), AZURE (Azure SQL, Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks), Stream-Processing systems, Storm, Spark-Streaming, OOD, Python, R, Java, C++, Scala --- REMOTE – Long Term Contract - Immediate Interview - Candidate should be located within 3 to 5 hours drive to Harrisburg, PA

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

JOB DESCRIPTION / REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE – ALL SKILLS ARE MUST

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are looking for a Sr. Data Engineer / Data Wrangler / Data Pipeline Builder to join its team of analytics professionals to support its Longitudinal Data System data integration services as well as system deployment and management efforts.

  • 7+ years of experience in a Sr. Data Engineer / Data Wrangler / Data Pipeline Builder.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field.
  • Experience with BIG DATA tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Oracle, MS SQL Server, Postgres, Cassandra, etc.
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
  • Experience with data integration services solutions from vendors such as Informatica, MuleSoft, Talend, TIBCO, etc.
  • Experience with CLOUD-based data services such as AWS (EC2, Glue, EMR, RDS, Redshift, etc.) and Azure (Azure SQL, Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, etc.)
  • Experience with Stream-Processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
  • Experience with Object-Oriented / Object Function scripting languages: Python, R, Java, C++, Scala, etc
  • Experience in expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.
  • Experienced Data Pipeline builder and Data Wrangler who has strong hands-on skills in optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and ‘BIG DATA’ technologies.
  • Build analytics tools that utilize the Data Pipeline to provide actionable insights into voting registration, execution, and results; operational efficiency; and other key business performance metrics.
  • The Data Engineer should have experience in supporting the application developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture.
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business area requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Advanced working SQL experience and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing ‘Big Data’ Data Pipelines, Architectures, and Data Sets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
  • They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products.
  • They must also be comfortable with supporting data conversions associated with system modernization and / or replacement efforts.
  • The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing the longitudinal data architecture to support our next generation of data initiatives.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Data, Design, and Support teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • Keep data separated and secure across Agency boundaries such as data centers and cloud regions.
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing data products needed to support ongoing operations and data driven decision making.
  • Work with data and analytics professionals to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
  • Qualifications:
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

Regards,

Suresh,

Recruiting Manager,

Linga Tech Inc,

Ph: 717-856-8189,

Email: suresh@lingatech.com,

Webste: www.lingatech.com

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
Job Description

Position: Senior Cloud Engineer

Location: Remote

Job Type: Contract

Duration: 12 Months to start

Job Description

This role will wear multiple hats assisting Cloud Architects to comprehend objectives, generate solutions, POC the solution, generate recommendations then implement the decisions.

As a Senior Cloud Engineer, we are looking for three different candidates who will be involved in the design, implementation and management of technology-based business solutions based on Cloud Services to improve our clients’ delivery approach.

This position will assist with the build out of a multi-cloud environment such as the public, private, and hybrid clouds. This professional draws on solid knowledge of the company’s cloud architecture and platform when designing and developing dynamic cloud solutions.

Required Skills
  • Senior Cloud Engineer 3 – 5 years
  • Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic Cloud solutions and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery. 3 – 5 years
  • Guidance to development teams regarding infrastructure 3 – 5 years
  • Cloud Architecting for cloud infrastructure 3 – 5 years
  • Experience with Servers, Infrastructure, Platform Sizing, Infrastructure Cost Reduction 3 – 5 years

Highly Desirable
  • Create, maintain, and troubleshooting skills for cloud infrastructure
  • Cloud security experience
  • Chaos engineering experience
  • Certification(s):
    • Google – Professional Cloud Architect
    • AWS – Solution Architect – Professional
    • Azure – MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure
Core Competencies
  • Design and deliver secure cloud solutions on Azure, AWS, GCP.
  • Strong understanding of Linux OS.
  • Chaos engineering experience
  • Strong understanding of virtual networks and general network management functions.
  • Solid knowledge of concepts of designing and developing dynamic cloud solutions.
  • Solid knowledge of concepts and moving parts involved in continuous integration and delivery.
  • Expert guidance to development teams regarding infrastructure.
  • Interpret and provide solutions on complex technologies/architectures.
  • Cloud Formation / automation / Ansible / PowerShell / DSC / Comparable Linux scripting.
  • Experience equivalent to site reliability engineering, DevOps, and/or DevSecOps

Core Tasks
  • Provide strategic and architectural support representing Design Services and the Cloud Strategy as a Subject Matter Expert.
  • Identify and prioritize critical business functions in collaboration with organizational stakeholders.
  • Build and maintain relationships across organizational teams.
  • Consult with vendor product specialists/sales, independent research organizations, on-site support engineers and fellow architects and administrators on best-fit technologies to ensure compliance to department policies & standards and technology roadmap.
  • Coordinate with Enterprise Architecture team for technology validation or suggestions for alternative solutions. If necessary, initiate Solution Assessments, Infrastructure Service.
  • Requests, and any applicable required documentation to implement new technology.
  • Advocate the use of emerging cyber security best practices, technologies, developing standards and procedures, promoting the usage of automated tools, developing strategies, and aligning practices with enterprise strategic initiatives.
  • Lead the development of technical artifacts including Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Detailed Technical Design, Security Architecture Plan, Services Description Document, etc.
  • Produce architectural framework documents (i.e., white papers, guidance documents, best practices, technical reports, etc.).
  • Project contributor representing architecture and participates in project plan development.
  • Leverage broad-based understanding of technology areas and end-to-end knowledge of current installations to craft architectural solutions or standards that can be applied across the enterprise.
  • Define and build hypothesis around steady state behavior.
  • Run experiments around real world events to define potential impact or estimate frequency.
  • Build automation into systems to drive both orchestration and analysis.
  • Provide support and subject matter expertise with respect to adherence to best practice security framework controls and other industry-based regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., NIST 800-37, 800-53, 800-171, 800-204, 800-207, CIS, PCI, IRS-Pub 1075, CJIS, and related).
  • Assist with cloud infrastructure design and develop detailed architecture models for the client to host test, development, and production environments.
  • Communicate complex technical concepts to individuals of various technical ability.
  • Design and develop cloud cost management solutions.
  • Provide performance analysis & troubleshooting.
  • Design and test large-scale workload and data migrations.
  • Provide direct support to technical and non-technical entities to define requirements and deliver solutions to meet organizational needs including new environment deployment, upgrades, performance tuning, testing and disaster recovery.
  • Integrate cloud services with on-premises technologies from Microsoft, Dell, EMC, HP, Nutanix, Cohesity, Pure Storage, VMware, Cisco, and Rubrick.

Queen Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer. Our goal is to promote an environment that helps our employees and clients appreciate the benefits that diversity provides.

title: Accessibility Engineer [70958]
description:
*Pay rate: $45-60/hr

*Location: Remote

*12 month

MUST have extensive PDF experience


A11y Engineer – QA. is responsible for supporting and equipping our engineering quality assurance teams to ensure successful delivery of our accessible digital products. This person will be supporting all aspects of integrating accessibility into manual and automated testing:

Responsibilities

  • Partner with Engineering QA in building A11y into manual and automated testing by:
  • helping understand how users experience products using Assistive Technology
  • helping understand what to test for and how to test to ensure feature functionality meets A11y AC (Acceptance Criteria).
  • manually testing key feature functionality to ensure A11y AC is met.
  • Partner with Engineering QA during testing, ensuring A11y AC is being met by:
  • ensuring feature functionality has A11y AC written / available
  • helping engineering QA team understand the A11y AC.
  • answering technical how-to questions on testing A11y for Web, IOS & Android apps.
  • helping engineering QA test and validate A11y AC.
  • Support 3rd-Party Audits by:
  • reviewing 3rd-Party findings, test results
  • re-test, verify reported findings if reported issue is questionable
  • create A11y user stories, defects for A11y findings
  • help triage, prioritize A11y issues with product and provide A11y context, guidance on how to remediate A11y findings.
  • Analyze validation test results looking for
  • training opportunities
  • engineering methods needing correction
  • components needing a11y refinements
  • processes lacking appropriate a11y support.
  • Attend relevant stand-ups and status meetings.

Unicorn Responsibilities

  • Bring a depth of development and technical knowledge that complements and strengthens a culture beginning to apply a11y practices in design, engineering and QA.
  • Apply accessibility knowledge to a wide range of client digital properties including but not limited to responsive websites, mobile applications, hybrids and digital documents.
  • Stay up-to-date on current and existing trends in the accessibility space.
  • Partner with Design A11y, Design System teams and Engineering A11y Leads to develop, promote the adoption and integration of accessibility policies, procedures, and standards.

Qualifications

  • Ability to think from an end-user perspective
  • Commitment to meeting high expectations of end users
  • Solid experience testing with all common screen readers (JAWS, NVDA, MAC/IOS VoiceOver, TalkBack), keyboard only, and other assistive technology.
  • Ability to interpret and advise on standards, principles and techniques for meeting accessibility success criteria (including WCAG 2.0 AA, WCAG 2.1 AA, and WAI-ARIA)
  • Ability to partner with various cross-functional teams for direction and consistency
  • Providing leadership when necessary
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Familiarity with Responsive Web Design and mobile apps
  • Fluency in the software development lifecycle
  • Strong understanding of supporting products in a SAFe environment specifically how current/future work is scheduled to come through planning, design, engineering and 3rd-party validation efforts
  • Knowledge of Rally, Teams, Confluence and other cooperation tools


What’s in our benefits packages:

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • 401k Program
  • Commuter Benefit
  • eLearning
  • Education Reimbursement
  • Ongoing Training & Development
  • *To qualify for our benefits package, you must work over 30 hours per week and the length of assignment must be a minimum of 10 weeks.

title: Sr. Contentful Engineer
description:
Sr. Contentful Engineer

Remote- East Coast Hours

Contract - 6 Months



About BigRio:

BigRio is a remote-based, technology consulting firm with headquarters in Boston, MA. We deliver software solutions ranging from: custom development, software implementation, data analytics, and machine learning/AI integrations. We are a one-stop shop that attracts clients from a variety of industries because of our proven ability to deliver cutting-edge and cost-conscious software solutions.

With extensive domain knowledge, BigRio has teams of data architects, data engineers, software engineers, web developers, and consultants who deliver best-in-class solutions across a variety of verticals. Our diverse industry exposure equips us with invaluable tools, tricks, and techniques to tackle complex software and data challenges.



About You:

We are looking for a Sr. Contentful Engineer/SME to lead the development and implementation of an Enterprise Contentful CMS platform.

This includes high-level architecture, setting up content models, creating content entries, routing rules and redirects, creating content types, and managing assets. The Contentful Engineer is also responsible for troubleshooting any issues with the CMS.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and maintain Contentful-based applications.
  • Integrate Contentful with other systems and services.
  • Create custom content models and content types.
  • Develop Contentful integrations and extensions.
  • Implement automated testing and quality assurance processes.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and developers.
  • Continuously monitor and optimize the performance of Contentful-based applications.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest Contentful developments, trends and technologies.
  • Work alongside software developers and architects, UX / UI visual designers and architects, and product developers.
  • Understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and approaches.
  • Experience in Agile development practices.
  • Proven ability to be effective and adaptable in response to frequent change and ambiguity
  • Tools: Jira, Confluence.
  • Migrate Sharepoint content to contentful by mapping it to the contentful data model and building necessary tools to automate the task.


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in web development, including 3+ years of experience with Contentful.
  • Expert-level knowledge of Contentful platform and web development technologies such as React, Node.js, and CSS.
  • Experience with integrating Contentful with other systems and services.
  • Proficiency in writing maintainable and scalable code.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Google Cloud Platform is a plus
  • Ability to Contentful data modeling
  • Implementing according to designs visuals for components and individual pages
  • Experience in integrating 3rd party services (translation) to contentful.
  • Advanced React front end skills, nodejs, typescript.
  • Static HTML and SSR experience.
  • Knowledge about visualizing contentful data for the web.



Equal Opportunity Statement

BigRio is an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws. BigR.io makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment.

The Mission Systems Engineering Autonomy & Mission Engineering Solutions Department (AMES) is seeking a dynamic Software Engineer to support integration activities within our Small Unmanned Aerial Systems (sUAS) business area. The sUAS engineering team touches all aspects and products within the department with opportunities to influence and own forward looking strategic planning, designing roadmaps, and architectures. As a systems-level team, this position has opportunities for direct customer and end user interaction as well as coordination across subsystem teams and stakeholders.

Demonstrated experience with embedded system development using a variety of development environments, languages, and tools (C, C++, C#, Python, Protobufs, etc.)

Understanding of DoD open systems architecture and protocols (FACE, JCA, HOST, OMS, SOSA)

Assisting in leading and coordinating the development of technical proposals as well as program level cost estimates during the bid and proposal cycle.

Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.

Demonstrated ability to adapt decision-making style based on the situational circumstances.

The successful candidate will be part of a distributed team composed of professionals from several disciplines and must have the ability to function well and have strong interpersonal skills. This position requires an individual that can perform with minimal direct supervisory support. As such the candidate must be highly motivated and a self-starter. The ability to coordinate several complex engineering activities while balancing priorities and schedules is a must. This position may require occasional travel (up to 10%).

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors degree and 5 years of prior relevant experience OR

Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 3 years experience OR

In absence of a degree, 9 years of relevant experience is required

Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 5 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Must have or be capable of obtaining a US Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance. Candidate selected will be subject to a government security investigation/reinstatement and must meet eligibility requirements

Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated experience with tools such as JIRA, Git, Subversion, Docker, and requirements management applications.

Experience working effectively in highly collaborative environments, a demonstrated ability to take ownership of tasks and lead technical efforts spanning multiple stakeholders and be able to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization as well as customers.

Experience in integrating and troubleshooting network connectivity issues (e.g., Linux routing, VLANs, good familiarity with IP protocol stack and protocols)

HMI / GUI development a plus

Familiarity with DevSecOps tools and techniques is a plus

This position requires an individual that can perform with minimal direct supervisory support. The ability to coordinate several complex engineering activities while balancing priorities and schedules is a must.

Background in the following technologies is helpful but not required:

UAS Command and Control Systems

Autonomy Algorithms

Detect and Avoid

Guidance and Navigation

Flight Management Systems

Sensor Fusion / Sensor Systems

Weapons Systems

Human / machine interface
