title: Principal Protocol Engineer - ZK Proofs (Remote)
company_sector: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!


Job details


Crypto Hardware Tech Startup is hiring for a ZK Cryptographer Engineer!


This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver


Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.


Salary $80 - $250 per hour


A Bit About Us


A cutting-edge cryptographic hardware startup is growing! The founder is a serial entrepreneur with a proven track record and they are backed by notable investors including Blockchain.com, Metaplanet, and 8090 Partners. They are developing the world's first cryptographic computer have a mission to revolutionize trust and privacy through innovative hardware solutions, empowering humanity to achieve unprecedented capabilities.


Their focus is on creating an accelerator for advanced cryptographic algorithms using zero-knowledge proofs, which could provide infrastructure for real-world blockchain applications in industries like healthcare, real estate, and finance. This technology is capable of proving the validity of a statement without revealing any private details, which could have widespread applications. As the company continues to grow, they are looking for a highly skilled Lead Engineer and Architect with expertise in Zero-Knowledge (ZK) Proofs and protocol development to join their team. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a groundbreaking movement that is changing the world of cryptography and empowering people to achieve new heights. If you have a passion for the crypto space and a proven track record of excellence, we encourage you to apply and be part of this revolutionary movement.




Why join us?


As a Principal Cryptography Engineer, you will


  • Lead the design and architecture of ZK protocols including ZK-STARK and ZK-SNARK systems and modern zero-knowledge proof designs
  • Develop, implement, and optimize ZK protocol components in languages like C++, Rust, and Go
  • Contribute to research and development of advanced cryptographic systems, such as threshold-signature schemes, Verkle trees, multiparty computation, and polynomial commitment schemes
  • Develop, implement, and test ZK protocol components
  • Collaborate with a dynamic team to create next-gen cryptographic hardware solutions
  • Contribute to research and development of anonymous transactions and advanced cryptographic systems, such as BulletProofs and Plonk


Job Details


Requirements


  • Proven experience in designing and architecting cryptographic protocols from scratch
  • Expertise in Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZK) and modern zero-knowledge proof designs
  • Strong hands-on coding skills, including professional experience with C++, Rust, Python, and Go
  • Experience with established blockchains or notable contributions on GitHub
  • Knowledge of cryptography concepts and principles


Hours


We offer flexible options for this position, with part-time and full-time contract-to-hire available. Short-term contracts or side work are also options for qualified candidates. Ideally, we prefer a full-time commitment of 40 hours per week, but are open to discussing different arrangements with the right candidate. Our priority is finding the best fit for our team


Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.

title: Software Engineer Senior - ETL Informatica
description:
This position is responsible for the design, delivery, support, and maintenance of data integration solutions—primarily using Informatica PowerCenter. Design, develop, implement, test, analyze, and support data integration software applications. This includes researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production life cycle. Analyze and debug in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required. May require after hours support.
  • Collaborate with project leads, business analysts, end users and third-party contacts to design, develop, implement, and test software applications.
  • Collaborate with other engineers, analysts, and designers in conceptualizing and developing new data integration programs and applications.
  • Plan phases of software development life cycle (SDLC) for a variety of projects.
  • Assist in the preparation and documentation of software requirements and specifications.
  • Research, finalize, consult, and document business, functional, technical requirements.
  • Recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades.
  • Perform Production Support on a rotation basis.
  • Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, increasing performance through SQL tuning, and general debugging.
  • Perform critical analysis of QA results and deliver updates to ensure excellent data quality.
  • Generate statistics and prepare and write reports for management and/or team members on the status of the programming process.
  • Write programming scripts to enhance functionality and/or appearance of company Web site and/or related Web applications as necessary.
  • Collaborate and lead other members of the IT department to assist in resolving problems associated with the integration of Informatica with schedulers, databases, file transport protocols, and external trading partners.
  • Create Atomic (UC4) jobs and schedule per the requirements of each project.
  • Other projects and duties as assigned.
 
Education
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science preferred; demonstrated experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
 
Required Experience
  • Seven years of experience designing and building enterprise integration solutions using Informatica PowerCenter.
  • Experience in developing ETL design guidelines, standards, and procedures to ensure a manageable and a low support-footprint ETL infrastructure and architecture.
  • Provide analysis and design reviews with development peers to avoid duplication and inefficiency.
  • Experience mentoring other ETL developers.
 
Preferred Experience
  • Two years working on Agile teams.

title: Remote Cloud Engineer Consultant
company_name: EDI Staffing, an EDI Specialists Company
description:
The Cloud Engineer is part of the App Engineering team leads the planning, design, implementation, and stabilization of platforms to support new application and technology solutions. This role will work closely with application teams to build the platforms which include Cloud application installation, configuration security, automation, monitoring, and platform management processes. This role will have the opportunity to define best practices and establish patterns for best-in-class Cloud delivery of applications. The Cloud Engineer will be the bridge of I&O, working closely with the Project Managers, Hosting, Network and Security teams to capture the platform requirements and define the deployment approach around on-prem, SaaS, PaaS, IaaS. This will play a key role in building out and expanding Cloud capabilities, infrastructure-as-a-code, and DevOps.

Responsibilities
  • Build and architect highly efficient, reliable, and scalable Cloud platforms hosting Enterprise and Business Managed solutions.
  • Successfully deliver Cloud platform for implementation and migration projects in accordance with company security guidelines
  • Develop, enhance, and maintain automation of Cloud enablement tools with a high level of resiliency and recoverability.
  • Establish best practices and processes for delivery of engineering demand.
  • Evaluate and lead application platform migration from on-prem to Cloud
  • Partner with security team to implement platform security hardening and design patterns to improve the security posture
  • Proactively assess and remediate platform vulnerabilities
  • Working closely with operations to ensure smooth transition of platforms to support, including recommendations for future automation and performance and capacity targets.
  • Document and publish new standards and design patterns
  • Vendor evaluation as part of the new technology innovation.
  • Partner with architecture to refine approaches for monitoring, capacity, and lifecycle
  • management.
  • Operationalize disaster recovery solutions.
  • Champion the resolution of technically significant issues affecting the platform through personal ownership, and coordinating teams, and stakeholders.
Experience:
  • 5+ years of IT experience with a focus on Cloud applications
  • Experience with Cloud and DevOps
  • Experience in Infrastructure Automation tools (i.e., Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Strong foundational experience in authentication and authorization protocols and tools
  • Experience in writing technical requirements and/or design specifications
  • Experience in Agile/Waterfall Project Delivery approach
  • Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
  • Ability to adjust to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines
  • Experience managing multiple complex tasks/initiatives spanning a variety of technology areas.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills with both technical and non-technical team members and stakeholders. Experience presenting to executive leadership.

title: Principal Protocol Engineer - ZK Proofs (Remote)
company_sector: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!


Job details


Crypto Hardware Tech Startup is hiring for a ZK Cryptographer Engineer!


This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver


Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.


Salary $80 - $250 per hour


A Bit About Us


A cutting-edge cryptographic hardware startup is growing! The founder is a serial entrepreneur with a proven track record and they are backed by notable investors including Blockchain.com, Metaplanet, and 8090 Partners. They are developing the world's first cryptographic computer have a mission to revolutionize trust and privacy through innovative hardware solutions, empowering humanity to achieve unprecedented capabilities.


Their focus is on creating an accelerator for advanced cryptographic algorithms using zero-knowledge proofs, which could provide infrastructure for real-world blockchain applications in industries like healthcare, real estate, and finance. This technology is capable of proving the validity of a statement without revealing any private details, which could have widespread applications. As the company continues to grow, they are looking for a highly skilled Lead Engineer and Architect with expertise in Zero-Knowledge (ZK) Proofs and protocol development to join their team. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a groundbreaking movement that is changing the world of cryptography and empowering people to achieve new heights. If you have a passion for the crypto space and a proven track record of excellence, we encourage you to apply and be part of this revolutionary movement.




Why join us?


As a Principal Cryptography Engineer, you will


  • Lead the design and architecture of ZK protocols including ZK-STARK and ZK-SNARK systems and modern zero-knowledge proof designs
  • Develop, implement, and optimize ZK protocol components in languages like C++, Rust, and Go
  • Contribute to research and development of advanced cryptographic systems, such as threshold-signature schemes, Verkle trees, multiparty computation, and polynomial commitment schemes
  • Develop, implement, and test ZK protocol components
  • Collaborate with a dynamic team to create next-gen cryptographic hardware solutions
  • Contribute to research and development of anonymous transactions and advanced cryptographic systems, such as BulletProofs and Plonk


Job Details


Requirements


  • Proven experience in designing and architecting cryptographic protocols from scratch
  • Expertise in Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZK) and modern zero-knowledge proof designs
  • Strong hands-on coding skills, including professional experience with C++, Rust, Python, and Go
  • Experience with established blockchains or notable contributions on GitHub
  • Knowledge of cryptography concepts and principles


Hours


We offer flexible options for this position, with part-time and full-time contract-to-hire available. Short-term contracts or side work are also options for qualified candidates. Ideally, we prefer a full-time commitment of 40 hours per week, but are open to discussing different arrangements with the right candidate. Our priority is finding the best fit for our team

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
POSITION TITLE: Senior Software Engineer

COMPANY: San Francisco Health Plan

DURATON: 6 month rolling

OPENINGS: 1

LOCATION: Remote


MUST HAVES

  • 7+ years of exp
  • Healthcare Experaince
  • Knowledge of the application lifecycle to support.
  • Understand application integration and be able to solve problems relating to system interoperability.
  • BizTalk, .NET Framework and ASP.NET(current supported version) and CLR languages, preferably C# and VB.NET.
  • WebForms, Console applications, XML, XSLT, XSD, AJAX, JSON, jQuery, Bootstrap.
  • MVC, Web API or WCF; SOA-based systems.
  • SQL Server 2016 development (complex SQL, store procedures, functions), SSIS packages and SSRS reports.
  • Know how to do Data analysis and data modeling (particularly OLTP design, 3rd normal form).


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create wrap-around applications that integrate with Jiva, QNXT and our Data Warehouse.
  • Assist in the retirement of our existing care management system, Essette.
  • Assist in the migration of data from Essette to Jiva.
  • Create and finalize technical specifications documents in response to approved business requirements.
  • Design, develop, test and deploy multi-tiered applications and batch processes.
  • Create and execute unit test plans based on system and validation requirements.
  • Troubleshoot, optimize, and tune applications.
  • Document all work-product, per SFHP’s best practices and standards.
  • Maintain existing code and fix defects whenever needed.
  • Ensure that all software is delivered on time as per project commitments.
  • Ensure smooth functioning of our development, QA, and production environments.
  • Collaborate with Business Systems Analysts on business requirements review
  • Conduct data analysis; identify issues; recommend and implement solutions.
  • Create ad-hoc and automated reporting solutions as needed
  • Perform other related duties and special projects as assigned.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & TRAINING REQUIRED

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • Experience working directly with business partners and Product Managers
  • Experience in building out new care management systems.
  • 7+ Years of Software engineering experience in a variety of programming languages
  • 7+ Years of BizTalk and .NET developer experience using Visual Studio.
  • 7+ Years of advanced SQL Server experience.
  • 7+ Years of proven ability in application development.
  • 3+ years delivering on large scale, high-visibility software development projects.
  • 2+ Years mentoring junior members of software development teams.

Worked on the complete SDLC from analysis of requirements to software deployment of at least 4 large projects (at least 2 of the projects must be as a Senior Engineer).

POSITION SUMMARY


  • Codes software applications that integrate with ZeOmega’s Jiva care management system and Cognizant’s QNXT claims processing system. Assist development teams in retiring our existing care management system, Essette. Assist development teams in migrating data from Essette to our new care management system Jiva. Works closely with team to design, build and maintain business applications and data automation processes. Applies common SDLC process methodologies (e.g., AGILE, SCRUM, Waterfall) to job function. Leverages Microsoft’s suite of technology platforms (i.e., SQL Server, ASP.NET, BizTalk, MVC, WCF, LINQ and TFS) to develop software that meets business needs. Architects, builds and tests highly optimized, object and service-oriented (SOA) software solutions, using BizTalk and the Microsoft .NET Framework. Designs, builds and tests web services to integrate applications. Reviews functional specifications and authors technical specification documents; reviews, clarifies and understands business requirements to provide the most efficient and optimal application to support business function. Serves as a SME for the common codebase.

title: IT Fast Formula Developer (Remote)
description:
Location:


Akron, OH, US, 44320


Job Function: Information Technology


Employee Type: Reg Full Time (FT)


Requisition ID: 69468


FirstEnergy


FirstEnergy at a Glance


As one of the nation’s largest electric utility companies with a focus on sustainable energy, FirstEnergy knows that it takes a workforce of highly trained, dedicated, and motivated individuals to generate and deliver safe and reliable power. Our Information Technology (IT) professionals are at the heart of this workforce, playing a key role in helping our business units achieve business goals in the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity. As a result, FirstEnergy invests in the success of its people through continuous development opportunities to develop and refine skills support career advancement. FirstEnergy is proud to develop new experiences for both employees and customers and is committed to developing a diverse workforce, reflective of the communities we serve, by recruiting and retaining talented employees from a variety of backgrounds


FirstEnergy’s in-house, centralized IT organization creates and maintains software solutions, and operates FirstEnergy data centers, service desks and voice/data networks. As an IT Professional at FirstEnergy, you will be given a wide range of opportunities to collaborate with people across the company and will be exposed to an exciting and cutting-edge technology stack. You will also be exposed to Agile ways of working in an environment that embraces diversity of thought, where you will be encouraged to innovate and explore new ideas.


About The Opportunity


This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Co., a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [SC00]


The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need. This option is not available in the states of California, Colorado, Illinois, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Montana, Nebraska, New York, Oregon or Washington at this time.


Responsibilities Include:
  • Build/Support of fast formulas for Oracle Human Capital Management Cloud solution.
  • Develop/Enforce governance for Oracle HCM Cloud solution fast formulas, including the development of needed formulas as identified by the Human Resources business.
  • Understanding of core HR processes around absence, payroll, compensation, talent management, recruiting and compliance to ensure technology solutions can be implemented to meet all current and emerging business requirements
    • Previous experience and technical knowledge of Absence, Payroll, Compensation, and Benefits specific fast formulas
    • Sound knowledge of concepts: element configuration, voluntary deductions, retro, arrears, accruals, work schedules, plan enrollment, benefits coverage, etc.
    • Solid knowledge of Oracle Cloud HCM table structures & BIP
    • Strong knowledge of commonly used fast formula types from prior implementations
    • Troubleshooting/debugging fast formula issues and providing resolutions or recommending alternatives
    • Understanding of US payroll concepts such as 401K plans, IRS limits, etc
    • Creating technical specification documentation
    • Creating and executing comprehensive unit test plans, developing test cases, assisting with integration, and completing system test plans
    • Unit, integration, performance and stress testing support for application enhancements, upgrades and patches
    • Developing technical designs and estimates to meet the business needs while supporting the company’s overall IT direction and standards
    • Solving complex problems and troubleshoot functionality for issue identification
    • Providing production support of implemented functionality
  • Enable the HR functions to optimize business outcomes using Oracle Cloud HCM by acting as a liaison between the business and IT
  • Provide business process support through maintenance of fast formulas
  • Participate in the review of new functionality for each system release, testing and implementation
  • Identify opportunities for improvements to fast formulas and collaborate with HR business unit on strategic direction of current processes
  • Documenting processes/procedures and specifications for peers.
  • Working independently or with business analysts to support requirements definition and test scenario identification.
  • Consistently delivering high quality results.


Qualifications include:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Management Information Systems, or a related degree along with 4 years of related experience. In lieu of a degree, 6 years of related experience.
    • Related experience includes, but is not limited to: hands-on experience working as an IT technical professional supporting Oracle Cloud HCM fast formulas.
  • Ability and willingness to travel to Company sites, work flexible hours, and be available for call-in and after-hours support (7x24 operations) when needed
  • Analytical and technical skills to resolve problems and think creatively.
  • Willingness to undertake assignments involving unfamiliar subjects, with the aptitude to learn quickly.
  • Ability to learn new concepts in information technology, learn the characteristics of new systems and update skills to adapt to changing technology.
  • Good interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team.
  • Strong communication skills, including the ability to make formal presentations to various audiences, the ability to express difficult and complex concepts clearly and concisely both orally and in writing.
  • Highly motivated to work independently and productively but also able to work in a virtual environment (working with remote co-workers using virtual technologies).
  • Ability to meet established priorities and schedules, and willing to undertake assignments involving multiple tasks.
  • Demonstrated ability to provide software solutions and supporting entire software development life cycle
  • Preferred experience with utility industry knowledge and software application configuration


Benefits, Compensation & Workforce Diversity


At FirstEnergy, employees are key to our success. We depend on their talents to meet the challenges of our changing business environment. We are committed to rewarding individual and team efforts through our total rewards philosophy which includes competitive pay plus incentive compensation, a company-sponsored pension plan, 401(k) savings plan with matching employer contribution, a choice of medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, and life insurance programs, as well as skills development training with tuition reimbursement. Please visit our website at www.firstenergycorp.com to learn more about all of our employee rewards programs. FirstEnergy proudly supports workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract. Unable to sponsor or transfer H-1B visas at this time.


Safety


Safety is a core value for FirstEnergy and is essential to all of our business activities. We ensure employees have the tools, information, and processes to perform their duties in a manner that assures safety for themselves, their co-workers, our customers and the public. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace, and to promote and maintain public safety. To meet these goals, we dedicate ourselves to achieving world-class safety standards.


Position Classification


Exempt


FirstEnergy Human Resources Team


Nearest Major Market: Akron


Nearest Secondary Market: Cleveland


Job Segment: Testing, Cloud, Payroll, Oracle, Database, Technology, Finance

title: Conga CPQ Specialist/Developer
description:
Conga CPQ Developer

Chicago, IL - Remote

POSITION SUMMARY

Looking for a proven Development Team lead with 6+ years of design/development experience and at least 2 full life cycle SalesForce.com and Apttus implementations in Quote through Contract (Configure Price Quote/CPQ & Contract life cycle management/CLM.

As a Development Team Lead you will be responsible for designing and developing customized solutions within the Salesforce/ Apttus CPQ platform. This will involve meeting with project managers and business stakeholders in analyzing business requirements and troubleshooting applications issues. Understanding business requirements and issues and converting them into a scalable technical solution design and drive development team to implement same.

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

• Minimum of 6+ years of IT experience (Minimum 3 + years of experience implementing Salesforce solutions from initiation to launch and at least 3+ years of experience configuring and developing on the Apttus/Conga CPQ managed package)

• Understanding of the Lead-To-Cash business process and experience in at least two to three large-scale full-life cycle implementations of Quote to- Contract (CPQ/ CLM) solutions

• Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas in easy to understand business terms to senior leaders.

• Ability to understand business requirements and convert them into a scalable solution design

• Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously; workload will be a blend of small, medium, and large implementation projects

• Experience operating in a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Agile environment.

• Strong expertise in Apttus Product management: managing products, bundles, inclusion rules, constraint rules.

• Strong expertise in Pricing management: Price dimensions and tiers, price rulesets, pricing callback class, validation callback class.

• Must have strong experience working in Visualforce, Apex classes & controllers, Triggers, Batch jobs, Workflows, and the REST API, Process builders, formulas, validations, test coverage, SOQL, SOSL, exception handling and other standard SFDC components

• Expertise on Apttus CLM contract management process

• Hands on experience with Apttus Intelligent Workflow Approval Process

• Ability to build and update complex X-Author Excel and Word templates

• Advanced understanding of the Salesforce.com data model and how and when to create custom objects vs. using Salesforce out-of-the-box functionality.

• Experience integrating Salesforce with different business systems as well as working with integration tools such as ETL preferred

• Strong analytical skills, including demonstrated proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic

title: Secret Cleared Software Engineer
company_sector: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Staffing and Recruiting
description:
**You must be a full US Citizen with an ACTIVE Secret (minimum) level Clearance to be considered**


Day to Day

  • Develops, documents and maintains architectures, requirements, algorithms, interfaces and designs for software systems.
  • Develops and maintains code and integrates software components into a fully functional software system.
  • Develops software verification plans, test procedures and test environments, executing the test procedures and documenting test results to ensure software system requirements are met.
  • Performs software project management and software supplier management functions. Develops, selects, tailors and deploys software processes, tools and metrics.
  • Executes and documents software research and development projects.
  • Serves as a subject matter expert for software domains, system-specific issues, processes and regulations.
  • Tracks and evaluates software team and supplier performance to ensure product and process conformance to project plans and industry standards.
  • Works under general direction.


Must Haves

  • Bachelor's, Master's or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry
  • 5+ years of experience programming in C, C++ or Ada (C++ preferred)
  • 5+ years of experience developing software for embedded systems, using one or more real-time operating systems (RTOS).
  • Experience with Wind River VxWorks or any version of Linux is preferred, but general understanding of an RTOS is acceptable (other applicable RTOS experience includes but is not limited to DDC-I Deos or Green Hills Software Integrity).
  • 2+ years of experience developing software using Git for repository revision control and configuration management (CM)

Pluses

  • 2+ years of experience developing board bring up software applications used for hardware checkout and design verification or developing resident test software (RTS) applications used for hardware environmental stress screening (ESS), qualification testing and acceptance test procedures (ATP)
  • 2+ years of experience developing middleware per applications programming interfaces (APIs) to open standards such as FACE (future airborne capability environment) and OMS (open mission systems)
  • 2+ years of experience developing software, including device drivers, per aircraft interface standards such as MIL-STD-1553B, ARINC 429, UART, CAN, ARINC 664, RS-485
  • 2+ years of experience developing cyber assured software per NSA National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) cybersecurity framework
  • 2+ years of experience developing Python scripts for automated Requirements Based Testing (RBT), regression and release testing
  • 2+ years of experience developing safety critical software per FAA DO-178C or MIL-STD-882E standards
  • 2+ years of experience developing software build environments utilizing cmake.
  • 2+ years of experience developing software as a certified Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprise (SAFe) professional

title: Biostatistician
description:
• Description:* The Biostatistician II or III is responsible for providing biostatistical support for multiple military suicide prevention research projects, including the conduct of clinical trials, and overseeing all aspects of the data management process. Responsibilities include: study planning, development of data collection forms and measures; development and maintenance of data collection, management, and analysis plans; data reconciliation and cleaning; tracking study recruitment; performing statistical analysis on data collected from clinical trials and other research studies; and preparation of recruitment reports and results for publication, presentation, and delivery to study sponsors.

Responsibilities: Serves as a lead strategist for investigators regarding appropriate statistical methods as well as being primarily responsible for design, methodology, sample size estimation, and data analytic plans for grant proposals, Institutional Review Board (IRB) protocols, and ongoing studies. Independently plans for and performs cross sectional and longitudinal statistical analysis, conducts power analyses, and initiates and manages the preparation of data analysis and results sections for manuscripts, conference presentations, and sponsor reports. Understands, develops, and executes all aspects of empirical data management (e.g., data collection form design, data entry instructions and coding manuals, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), data management and quality assurance plans, resource planning, data status tracking). Takes a leadership role in organizing the data analytic team in collaboration with study PIs, and ensures quality and accuracy of work, realistic deadlines are set, and appropriate resources are available to accomplish tasks. Regularly monitors and reports on team progress, and problem-solves challenges promptly, to ensure that critical elements are proceeding on schedule. Works with study PIs and senior scientists to coordinate multiple, highly complex and/or large studies concurrently.

Tracks recruitment numbers and prepares recruitment reports and CONSORT diagrams for manuscripts and study sponsors.

Maintains study information on clinicaltrials.gov. Provides guidance, mentorship, and data management/ statistical training for junior-level staff and doctoral students. Serves as active contributor to team discussions about methodology and statistics, and leads meetings independently. May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned or directed by the supervisor. This may include attendance of and participation in required training for role. *Additional Skills & Qualifications:* Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Prefer doctoral with 0-2 years but would also be open to MS 6-8 years

Biostatistician II Bachelor's Degree Minimum of 6-8 years experience required OR Master's Degree Minimum of 3-5 years experience required Biostatistician III (Strongly Preferred) Bachelor's Degree Minimum of 9-10 years experience required Master's Degree Minimum of 6-8 years experience required Doctoral Degree Minimum of 0-2 years experience required (Strongly Preferred) Advanced knowledge of statistics and study design. Experience in the design and execution of clinical trials. Proficiency in Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) or other data analytic software (e.g., SAS, Stata). Knowledge of databases and other software such as Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Proficiency in REDCap and other survey collection software (e.g., Qualtrics). Experience in data management, statistical analysis of longitudinal or repeated measurement data. Ability to communicate effectively in a timely manner, in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills. Excellent leadership and management skills. Prior experience with psychology research, clinical trials, military mental health, and/or suicide research highly desired. *Experience Level:* Expert Level

• Proficiency in using Azure DevOps to manage the development, testing, and deployment of Azure Sentinel solutions.

• Strong understanding of security principles and best practices.

• Experience with scripting languages, such as PowerShell and Python.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with other security and IT teams.

  • Degree B.S. in Business, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.

  • Initiative Candidates must demonstrate success as self-starting, hardworking, and inquisitive workers.

Good to Have :


  • Server-side development experience building restful APIs in frameworks like node.js
  • JavaScript/React Native

title: Human Factors Engineer
description:
OUR PROJECT

Immediate opportunity to join our team developing a UI/UX program for a medical device manufacturing organization.

This is a six-month contract position with competitive compensation that is fully remote.


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are looking for a Human Factors Engineer to support the establishment of human centered design process. You will be responsible for supporting the stand-up of a new Human Factors methodology for new feature delivery. Prior leadership experience for UI/UX and Human Factors design in a program manager capacity is required. Expertise working in regulated environments and with FDA, IEC 62366, 60601-1-6, MDR, and HE75 standards is strongly preferred. This is an excellent opportunity to build up a highly visible program.

We are interviewing qualified candidates immediately and will move into the offer stage quickly. If you are interested, please apply with an updated resume.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience implementing usability engineering methodologies
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams and delivering process documents
  • Experience with FDA, IEC 62366, 60601-1-6, MDR, and HE75 standards
  • HFD, HCD, UI/UX educational background a plus


Effective written and verbal communication skills are absolutely required for this role. You must be able to work LEGALLY in the United States as NO SPONSORSHIP will be provided. NO 3rd PARTIES.

title: Lead Dot NET Engineer
description:
Job Role: Lead Dot NET Engineer

Location: Remote These states are excluded from consideration: IA, MO, GA, OH, OK, AR, LA, MS, AL, TN, FL, NC, SC, VA, MD, DE, PA

Duration: 12-month Contract

Visas: GC or Citizen Only.!

10+ Years of Experience

Top Mandatory skills: .Net, Angular, Azure, 3+ yrs of Lead exp


Job Summary

The Principal Software Engineer is accountable for the prioritization, development, quality, performance, scalability, security, and operationalization of SaaS products in support of the business. This includes processes and standards on writing, coding, testing, security, production monitoring & alerting, and analyzing software programs and applications. The Principal Software Engineer will also lead the effort to research, design, document, and modify software definition through ongoing production monitoring and support. As a leader in the organization this role is responsible for the coaching and mentoring of team members in DevOps Culture, highly scalable architectures, and lean development utilizing Agile practices.


Major Duties


Software Development:

• Passion for building quality products/services while staying current on technical best practices

• Lead research, identification, and analysis in order to fulfill delivery of value for all internal and external stakeholders for new or existing software applications

• Focus on automation, continuous improvement, and lean delivery of value for customers

• Identify risk and provide recommendations, drive the software engineering schedule, and lead the effort in performing software improvements, deployments, and operationalization

• Collaborate with Architects to develop and maintain code quality and architecture standards

• Creative and innovation-driven with the ability to articulate engineering design patterns related to scale, performance, security, and usability


Agile Teamwork:

• Partner with Product Owners and team members to drive the definition of software development plans, including scoping, estimates, implementation, and operationalization and drive for results

• Develop standards and reusable process for all software engineering

• Provide technical advice, instruction and training to software engineers with less experience


Issue Resolution:

• Drive highest level production monitoring, scaling, alerting, and support to optimize value to customers efficiently

• Collaborate with peers, managers and customers to resolve problems with software products or company software systems.


Required Experience

• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Sciences, Mathematics, Engineering, Business, or area of functional responsibility preferred, or a combination of equivalent education and experience

• Proven experience in a DevOps Culture focusing on the customer, CI/CD, ‘Production is King”, cross-functional autonomous teams, and continuous improvement

• 10+ years’ experience developing enterprise scale .NET and SaaS solutions

• 3+ years in a Lead / Principal software engineering role on a product team larger than 20 members

• Experience designing, building, and optimizing enterprise scale integration environments

• Demonstrated experience with microservices architecture within major cloud service provider (Azure preferred)

• Deep Understanding of Angular (v10+)

• Deep understanding of CSS/SASS. Experience translating “pixel-perfect” mock-ups into working components. Understands reactive/adaptive css.

• Confident in Angular concepts required for advanced component development, such as: zones, transclusion, lifecycle stages, change detection, overlays

• Excited about building deeply custom UI experiences

• (not just composing views with off-the-shelf components)

• Experienced with the Angular CDK

• Experience creating reusable angular libraries preferred

• Confident user of chromium dev tools for debugging

• Confident user of chromium dev tools for profiling: able to quickly determine request vs render vs script bottlenecks, zero in on offending code

• Understands NG change detection strategies and how to incrementally improve in a large application

• Fluent with at least one state management system within Angular (ngrx/ngxs/akita/etc). Understands how to structure/share/query state for complex UI requirements.

• Some experience with e2e testing (selenium-based or cypress)

• Experience writing unit tests with at least one unit testing framework, such as Jasmine and Karma, Jest, etc.

title: Mainframe Engineer

title: Senior CyberSecurity DevOps Engineer
company_sector: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!


Job details


Fully Remote; Start-Up Experience a Plus! Stability of a global, multi-national company with the feel of a startup. Consulting-to-Hire Opportunity


This Jobot Job is hosted by Chelsea Piekarski


Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.


Salary $70 - $90 per hour


A Bit About Us


Global engineering, architecture, and construction firm that provides a wide range of consulting and professional services to clients across various industries. The firm was founded in 1898! We have over 7,600 employees and operate from more than 50 offices worldwide, including in North America, South America, Europe, and the Middle East.




Why join us?


We are known for our commitment to employee satisfaction and professional development. The company has been recognized by several organizations as a great place to work, including Fortune magazine, which has named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For. We offer a wide range of interesting and challenging projects across various industries, which provide a stimulating and rewarding work environment. The company also prides itself on its collaborative and team-oriented culture, which can provide a supportive and engaging workplace for employees.


Job Details


The Senior Cybersecurity DevOps Engineer is the primary advocate and subject matter expert for adopting and evolving DevOps principles and practices within the department. The Senior Cybersecurity DevOps Engineer nurtures the adoption of a DevOps culture in department personnel who deliver cybersecurity service offerings. The Senior Cybersecurity DevOps Engineer provides secure, scalable, and highly available cloud infrastructure and leads the adoption, optimization, and evolution of the DevOps toolchain. The Senior Cybersecurity DevOps Engineer coordinates continuous integration of changes to the cloud computing initiatives between internal teams, product management, and leadership to ensure solutions and operations requirements are met.


Job Duties


  • Mentors colleagues in designing, deploying and monitoring secure, scalable, and highly available cloud infrastructure.
  • Leads the adoption, optimization, and evolution of the DevOps toolchain used by department colleagues to provide continuous integration, deployment and monitoring of cloud infrastructure and modern compute workload.
  • Leads by example in provisioning, configuration and maintaining cloud infrastructure and workloads, through the practices of infrastructure as code, continuous testing, integration, deployment and monitoring.
  • Coordinates the continuous integration of changes to cloud computing initiatives between internal teams, product management and leadership to ensure solutions and operations are aligned with business objectives.
  • Leads and coordinates outage and technical troubleshooting investigations.
  • Orchestrates, manages, and maintains infrastructure as code repositories.
  • Responsible for performing peer review of infrastructure as code reviews and in performing and resolving merge request operations.
  • Responsible for managing, reporting, and optimizing cloud computing costs.
  • Incorporate automated and continuous change testing in individual contributions and promote team use of unit, integration and pre-deployment testing of infrastructure and workload changes.
  • Build effective relationships with team members, cloud users, vendors, contractors, and product management.
  • Support team efforts in preparing project budgets and cost estimates and reporting on project performance.
  • Provide leadership, guidance, and instruction to the practice.
  • Mentor and guide less experienced staff.
  • Responsible for QA/QC process adherence.
  • Responsible for effective communication with other disciplines.
  • Responsible for compliance with company and site safety policies.
  • All other duties as assigned.


Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems or related field.
  • Minimum 10 years’ experience.
  • Delivery of complex software solutions consistently on time with little to no errors.
  • Able to perform IT work or leads a team to perform work.
  • Good communication with team and customer.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills.


Preferred


  • Minimum of 4 years as a client of a major Cloud Infrastructure-as-a-Service provider
  • Minimum of 5 years DevOps experience.
  • Expert knowledge in DevOps principles and practices.
  • Proficient at orchestrating cloud computing resources in AWS, Azure, or GCS.
  • Proficient at authoring instructions in at least two of the following terraform, ansible, AWS CloudFormation, ansible, Azure automation, Puppet, Chef, Google Cloud Deployment Manager, or SaltStack.
  • Proficient at authoring and troubleshooting scripts or programs in at least three of the following bash, PowerShell, Python, Rust, Perl, Go, JavaScript, or Java.
  • Expert user of the distributed source code version control software git.
  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience with a Continuous Integration pipeline tools like GitHub Actions, GitLab-CI, Concourse CI, Jenkins, TeamCity, Bamboo, or Travis
  • Experience with mentoring new DevOps team members for large projects and delegating work tasks to team members. Ability to lead execution of work and resolve issues in a team environment.
  • Proficient with using ticketing and work management solutions to collaborate on technical projects by creating issues, tasks, and stories and by organizing work with Kanban, with sprints or another widely published Agile system.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking skills, ability to work methodically and analytically in a problem-solving environment.


Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!
